intro: Vagnera angustifolia, commonly known as the narrowleaf vagnera, is a perennial herb native to the southern United States. It features slender, upright stems with narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale pink, typically blooming in late spring. Vagnera angustifolia prefers full sun to partial shade and well-drained soils. It is often used in native plant gardens for its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
